Name: Acacia erioloba
Description: 4 - 12 m tall, yellow flowers, woody pods 130 mm long, grey-green leaves 100 mm, leaflets 13 mm, straight thorns 60 mm, rough fissured bark

Name: Acacia erubescens
GBIF_NAME: Senegalia erubescens (Welw. ex Oliv.) Kyal. & Boatwr.

Name: Acacia haematoxylon
Description: up to 8 m tall, yellow flowers, leaves and pods with fine grey hairs

Name: Acacia hebeclada hebeclada
Description: 2 – 6 m tall, white flowers, hairy leaves and pods

Name: Acacia hereroensis
Description: 5 m tall; paired, hooked thorns; long spikes of cream-coloured flowers; fruit is a long, flat, red-brown pod

Name: Acacia karroo
Description: 3 - 6 m tall, yellow flowers

Name: Acacia luederitzii
Description: up to 8 m tall, creamy-white flowers

Name: Acacia mellifera
Description: shrub, white flowers, small feather-shaped round leaves, small blackish hook thorns in pairs, very thorny

Name: Acacia nilotica subsp. kraussiana
GBIF_NAME: Vachellia nilotica subsp. kraussiana (Benth.) Kyal. & Boatwr.

Name: Acacia tortilis subsp. heteracantha
GBIF_NAME: Vachellia tortilis subsp. heteracantha (Burch.) Kyal. & Boatwr.

Name: Acanthosicyos naudinianus
Description: melon plant, creeping growth, yellow flowers, yellow, thorny, oval-shaped fruits of approx. 250 g, fruit and seeds edible, long root tuber

Name: Accipiter badius
Description: carnivore; body-length: 28-30 cm; grey plumage above; russet barring below; yellow legs and cere

Name: Acinonyx jubatus
Description: carnivore; height: 70-90 cm, the Cheetah is a large cat with long legs and a small head; the coat is yellowish-white with black spots; the ears are small and round; the Cheetah is the fastest land animal reaching speeds of more than 100 km/h; it can be distinguished from the Leopard by its longer legs and the characteristic tear marks extending from the eyes to the mouth;

Name: Acrotome inflata
Description: annual herb; up to 50 cm; small white flowers, packed in dense rows in spherical axillary inflorescendes; hardy, rectangular, finely ripped stalk; few opposite, pendent leaves

Name: Adenium oleifolium
Description: succulent, up to 1 m tall, large stem tuber above the ground, longitudinal leaves, pink flowers

Name: Aepyceros melampus
Description: herbivore; height: 90 cm; females lack horns

Name: Aepyceros melampus melampus
Description: herbivore; height: 90 cm; reddish-brown back, light brown flanks and white belly; three black stripes on the hindquarters; females are smaller and lack horns

Name: Aepyceros melampus petersi
Description: herbivore; height: 90 cm, dull brown coat, lighter brown on the flanks and white on the belly; black blaze on the face; females are smaller and lack horns

Name: Aethomys namaquensis
Description: herbivore; length:23-29 cm, tail-length: 15 cm; the fur is yellowish-brown with lighter underparts; the tail is covered in scales

Name: Albizia anthelmintica
Description: up to 6 m tall, yellow or creamy-white flowers, feathery leaves, no thorns, large light brown pods

Name: Alcelaphus buselaphus
Description: herbivore; height: 110-150 cm; the coat is glossy red-brown; the outside of the legs and the tail are black; the buttocks are light; there is a black blaze on the face; the snout is very long; the shoulders are humped and the back is sloped; the horns rise from a single pedicel and are S-shaped;

Name: Alopochen aegyptiaca
Description: omnivore; body-length: 70 cm; brown plumage; darker on the upperwing; dark brown patch on the chest; brown and white bill

Name: Amblysomus hottentotus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 11-15 cm; these barrel shaped moles have a smooth dark brown to reddish fur; the eyes are covered in skin and are completely blind; the openings of the ears are covered with fur and not visible; the short, strong limbs are ideal for digging;

Name: Ammocharis coranica
Description: decidous, perennial plant with a large, burried bulb; the leaves grow in a basal rosette; the inflorescence is a spherical head with many tubular, red flowers

Name: Anas erythrorhyncha
Description: omnivore; body-length: 48 cm; dark cap; cream coloured face with red bill; black and white plumage, paler on the belly

Name: Anthephora pubescens
Description: perennial grass; up to 1,5 m tall; broad leaves with crinkled margins; inflirescence is a compact skipe with hairy spikelets

Name: Antidorcas marsupialis
Description: herbivore; height: 90 cm; white face with two brown stripes; light brown back, white belly; both sexes have horns

Name: Antizoma angustifolia
GBIF_NAME: Antizoma angustifolia Miers ex Harv. & Sond.

Name: Aonyx capensis
Description: carnivore; body-length: 75-90 cm; the upper parts of the body are chestnut while the belly, chest, throat and face are lighter coloured; the paws are clawless except for three digits of the hind paws; they can be distinguished from the Spotted-necked Otter by the bigger size and the lack of spots on the throat;

Name: Aptosimum lineare
Description: herb; up to 20 cm tall; multiple stems growing from a long rootstock; linear-lanceolate leaves; tubular, blue or purple flowers; fruit is a capsule

Name: Aquila rapax
Description: carnivore; body-length: 65-80 cm; variable colouration ranging from dark brown to allmost white; pale undeside

Name: Ardeotis kori
Description: omnivore; body-length: 135 cm; grey-brown plumage; long neck

Name: Argemone ochroleuca
Description: coarse annual herb, up to 60cm tall, long sturdy tap root, grey-green, deeply lobed leaves with tips ending in a thorn, light yellow to cream-coloured flowers, seeds can last up to 20 years, grows in riverbeds

Name: Aristida congesta
Description: tufted grass, 70cm tall, long white hair where the leaf blade and the leaf sheath join, inflorescence is a dens panicle, spikelets with three awns

Name: Aristida meridionalis
Description: perennial grass, up to 1,8m tall, woolly haira at the leaf sheath mouth, inflorescence is a large open panicle

Name: Asparagus africanus
Description: shrub, up to 2m tall, curved branches with sharp spines, leaf-like structures (cladodes) in dense clusters, sweetly scented white flowers, fruit is a red berry

Name: Asparagus bechuanicus
Description: greyish-green shrub, up to 6m tall, the branches bear sharp spines, instead of leaves they have modified stems the cladodes, the flowers are cream-white, the fruit is a red to orange berry

Name: Asparagus nelsii
Description: shrub, 1m high, spiny branches with greyish-green leaf-like structures (cladodese), white to pale-cream flowers, red berrys

Name: Atelerix frontalis
Description: insectivore; the back and flanks are covered with back and white spines; on the forehead is a characteristic white band; the snout is pointed;

Name: Atilax paludinosus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 45-60cm; the fur of this large mongoose ranges from black to rust-brown; the underside and the cheeks are lighter; the head is broad and the ears lie flat;

Name: Barleria pretoriensis
Description: erect, perennial herb; up to 75 cm tall; smooth stems grow from a woody rootstock; opposite, lanceolate leaves with a toothed margin; leaf ends in a sharp spine; white, tubular flowers that turn mauve with age; fruit is a hairy capsule

Name: Bauhinia petersiana
Description: shrub; 2m tall; lobed leaves;large white flowers with large, crinkly petals, long, many-seeded pods;

Name: Boophone disticha
Description: decidous, perennial; up to 30 cm; partially burried bulb; erect greyish-green leaves that form a characteristic fan-shaped crown; pink, sweet scented flowers in a spherical inflorescence

Name: Boscia albitrunca
Description: 2–4m tall, small flowers, no petals, grey to whitish-grey bark

Name: Boscia foetida
Description: small tree or shrub, greenish flowers without petals, unpleasant scent of the flowers, yellowish berries about 10mm in diameter

Name: Brachiaria nigropedata
Description: tufted grass; up to 1,2 m tall; the hairy spikelets have a black stalk

Name: Bubulcus ibis
Description: carnivore; body-length: 54 cm; white and light brown plumage; yellow bill; breeding bird has a red bill; often found in association with cattle

Name: Buteo buteo
Description: carnivore; body-length: 45-50 cm; plumage colour varies from pale brown to nearly black

Name: Camptorrhiiza strumosa
Description: geophyte; up to 40 cm tall; with horizontal tuber; two rows of leaves arranged in zig-zag; pale mauve and green flowers

Name: Canis adustus
Description: omnivore; height: 35-50cm; the coat is grey or greyish-brown with a white stripe on each flank;  the belly and insides of the legs are lighter; the ears stand erect; the dark,bushy tail has a white tip which distinguishes the Side-striped Jackal from the Black-backed Jackal;

Name: Canis mesomelas
Description: omnivore; height: 30-50cm; the body and legs are red-brown; the insides of the legs, the belly and the throat are whitish; on the back and shoulders is a characteristic black saddle; the ears stand erect; the tail is bushy and black; the Black-backed Jackal is smaller than the Side-striped Jackal and lacks the white tip on the tail;

Name: Caracal caracal
Description: carnivore; the coat is reddish-brown to brick-red, the belly and chest are white; this cat has remarkably strong hind legs and a short tail; the ears are large and pointed with large tufts of black hair, the back of the ear is black; they have black marks around the eyes and at the base of the whiskers;

Name: Catophractes alexandri
Description: shrub, large trumpet-shaped white flowers, sometimes slightly pink, hairy blue-grey leaves, hard black thorns in pairs, fruit is a woody capsule

Name: Cenchrus ciliaris
Description: perennial grass, 1m tall, buffy form, inflorescence is a dense, purple to straw-colored spike, the spikelets are surrounded by wavy bristles

Name: Centropodia glauca
Description: grass, up to 1m tall, very hardy, almost succulent-like culms, short blue-green leaves

Name: Cephalophus natalensis
Description: herbivore; height: 40cm; chestnut to reddish-brown coat with a slightly leghter belly; a tuft of dark hair between the horns; the ears are short and rounded; the tail has a white tip; both sexes have short horn which lie backwards in line with the face;

Name: Ceratotherium simum
Description: herbivore; height: 150-180cm; the body is barrel-shaped with a low hanging head; the ears are pointy; the head is long with two horns on the snout, the front horn being the bigger one (± 85 cm); the square lips are characteristic; the white Rhinoceros is bigger than the black Rhinoceros

Name: Cercopithecus mitis
Description: omnivore; body-length: 50-65cm, tail-length: 50 cm; the upper parts of the body are grey, the limbs are darker, the chest and belly are dull yellow; the face is black, just above the brow line is a prominent row of forward pointing white fur;

Name: Chaerephon pumilus
Description: insectivore; body-length: 5-25 cm, wing-span: 25 cm; dark brown back, lighter belly; oversized round ears;

Name: Chlorocebus aethiops
Description: omnivore; body-length: 40-60 cm, tail-length: 30-50 cm; the fur is light grey with the belly and flanks even lighter; the face is black with a white fringe surrounding it; in males the scrotum and surrounding area are bright blue or greenish coloured;

Name: Choiromyces echinulatus
Description: truffle-like fungus; sometimes encountered in vicinity to Kalahari truffle (Terfezia pfeilii), but is whiter and more compact, round and has a softer texture than the Kalahari truffle; dark brown veins in the white meat; unpleasant taste

Name: Ciconia abdimii
Description: carnivore; body-length: 76 cm; black plumage; white lower back and rump; greenish bill and legs;

Name: Citrullus lanatus
Description: annual, creeping herb; the hairy leaves are divided into 3-5 lobes; male and female flowers grow on the same plant and are yellow; the fruit is round with a diameter of 15-20 cm and a yellow and green surface

Name: Civettictis civetta
Description: omnivore; height: 40 cm; the body is silver or cream in colour with distict, black stripes and spots on the hindquarters; a black mark begins between the ears and extends to the tip of the tail; the legs are black; the face is black around the eyes, grey on the forehead and white around the muzzle;

Name: Cleome angustifolia
Description: erect, annual herb; up to 1,5 m; spider-like yellow flowers with a reddish base and two large petals; fast-growing; thin, hairy pods 8 cm long; many compound, linear leaves

Name: Combretum apiculatum
Description: shrub or small tree; up to 10 m tall; shiny, oblong leaves with a notch at the tip

Name: Combretum collinum subsp. ondogense
GBIF_NAME: Combretum collinum subsp. ondongense (Engl. & Diels) Okafor

Name: Combretum collinum subsp. gazense
GBIF_NAME: Combretum collinum subsp. gazense (Swynn. & E.G.Bak.) Okafor

Name: Connochaetes gnou
Description: herbivore; height: 100-120 cm; the coat is dark brown; the white tail is long and horse-like; they have a straight, light brown mane; the face is dark and has hair on the nose and a beard; both sexes have horns that curl forward;

Name: Connochaetes taurinus
Description: herbivore; height: 115-145 cm; the coat is dark grey-brown with vertical darker stripes on the neck and flanks; the mane, face, beard and long tail are black; both sexes have horns that curve sideways; the males are considerably larger than the females

Name: Coturnix coturnix
Description: omnivore; body-length: 18 cm; speckled brown plumage

Name: Coturnix delegorguei
Description: omnivore; body-length: 18 cm; dark brown plumage on the back; chestnut with black streaks below; black breast

Name: Crinum foetidum
Description: perennial, bulbous plant; up to 35 cm tall; few green-blue leaves; inflorescence is a umbel with multiple, long, white flowers;fruit is a large capsule with  black seeds

Name: Crocidura hirta
Description: insectivore; length: 13 cm, tail-length: 4; this greyish brown shrew has a short tail, a long snout and large round ears; the eyes are small;

Name: Crocuta crocuta
Description: carnivore; height: 70-90 cm; the colour ranges from dull yellow to white, with irregular dark spots;it has a short mane and overall short hair; the animal has a large head with round ears, e strong neck and a sloping back;

Name: Crotalaria orientalis
GBIF_NAME: Crotalaria orientalis Burtt Davy ex Verdoorn
Description: shrub, 1m tall, straight stems, small leaves, whitish to yellow flowers (similar to pea-flower), the fruit is an inflated pod

Name: Crotalaria podocarpa
Description: annual herp with spreading stems; up to 3 cm tall; trifoliate leaves; pale yellow flowers; fruit is an inflated pod with stiff hair

Name: Crotalaria spartioides
Description: many branched shrub, bottle-green, only lives for 2-3 years, large bright yellow flowers, moderately poisonous

Name: Cryptomys hottentotus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 10-16 cm; the thick fur is grey or brown, in some individuals a white blaze is found on the head; the eyes are not well developped;

Name: Cucumis africanus
Description: creeping growth, runners can grow to a length of 50 m, 7 cm long spiny fruit, can be bitter or sweet

Name: Cynictis penicillata
Description: carnivore; the colour varies from yellowish-red to grey; the underside is slightly lighter;

Name: Cyperus margaritaceus
Description: small sedge; up to 50 cm tall; light-coloured inflorescence

Name: Cyperus usitatus
Description: sedge with many thin, linear leaves with a single peduncle ending in a tuft of compressed brown buds, bulb is edible

Name: Cyphostemma congestum
GBIF_NAME: Cyphostemma congestum (Baker) Desc. ex Wild & R.B.Drumm.

Name: Cyphostemma hereroense
GBIF_NAME: Cyphostemma hereroense (Schinz) Desc. ex Wild & R.B.Drumm.
Description: creeping, perennial herb; up to 50 cm tall; dissected, 5-lobed, succulent leaves; fruit is a bright red grape

Name: Damaliscus lunatus
Description: herbivore; height: 100-150cm; the coat is dark reddish-brown; they have a dark blaze on the face; also the upper parts of the legs are black; they have a hump on the shoulders and the back slopes downwards: both sexes have horns; the horns are ringed and S-shaped;

Name: Damaliscus pygargus dorcas
Description: herbivore; height: 90cm; the coat is very colourful, the top of the back and the neck are light brown getting darker on the flanks and legs; the belly, the lower legs and a patch around the crop are white; the face is brown with two large, white blazes which usually merge; both sexes have horns; it can be distinguished from the Blesbok by the white patch around the crop

Name: Damaliscus pygargus phillipsi
Description: herbivore; height: 85-100cm; the neck and top of the back are brown; the flanks and buttocks are darker; the belly and part of the legs are white; the face is brown with a small blaze above the eyes and a big blaze on the snout; the ears are white and pointy; the tail is black and bushy; both sexes have horns; it differs from the Bontebok by the blazes on the face being seperated;

Name: Dendromus melanotis
Description: herbivore; body-length: 6-9cm, tail-length: 7-13 cm; ash-grey on the back and whitish on the underside; the long, curly tail is used for climbing; the eyes are large;

Name: Dicerocaryum eriocarpum
Description: perennial, hairy herb; creeping growth; the leaves are lobed; white to pink, trumpet-shaped flowers; the fruit is a disk with two thorns

Name: Diceros bicornis
Description: herbivore; height: 130-180cm; the the body is barrel shaped with the head held higher than the white Rhinoceros does; the ears are rounded; two horns grow on the snout, the front one is usually larger; the upper lip is pointed;

Name: Dichrostachys cinerea
Description: shrub or small tree; 1-3m tall, flowers in an elongated drooping spike, composed of two sections: a pink tuft of sterile flowers and below a section of fertile yellow flowers; the pods are curly anr twisted;

Name: Dichrostachys cinerea africana
GBIF_NAME: Dichrostachys cinerea subsp. africana Brenan & Brummitt

Name: Dicoma capensis
Description: creeping herb; multiple stems grow from a perennial rootstock; hairy leaves; mauve flowerheads

Name: Egretta garzetta
Description: carnivore; body-length: 65 cm; white plumage, black bill; yellow toes

Name: Ehretia rigida
Description: Shrub, 1-3m tall, small green leaves clustered on reduced shots, the pale mauve, bluish or white tubular flowers are sweetly scented, the berry changes from yellow to black while ripening,

Name: Elanus caeruleus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 33 cm; grey above; white below; black shoulders; red eyes

Name: Elephantorrhiza elephantina
Description: small shrub, up to 60cm tall, extended underground tuberous root system, annual stems, creamy-yellow racemes, turning brown with age, woody flat pods, roots edible

Name: Elephantulus intufi
Description: carnivore; length: 24cm, tail-length: 12cm; grey-brownish coloured fur; elongated highly mobile snout; thin round ears; white rings around the large eyes; long sparsely haired tail;

Name: Elephantulus myurus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 26cm; the dorsal coat is brownish-grey and the underside is white, the hind legs are more developed than the forelegs; the nose is long and trunk-like;

Name: Enneapogon cenchroides
Description: hardy grass, 1m tall, leaves and culms covered with velvety hairs, the nodes are hairy, inflorescence is a hairy panicle, the spikelets typically have nine, hairy-fringed awns

Name: Epomophorus gambianus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 12-25cm; wingspan: 50cm; the fur is greyish brown to nearly white in colour; the face appears dog-like with the long snout and the simple ears, at the base of which are a white marks; the males are larger and have characteristic patches of white fur on the shoulders;

Name: Epomophorus wahlbergi
Description: herbivore; body-length: 12-25cm; wingspan: 50cm; greyish to white fur; dog-like face; white patch at the base of the ear; males are larger and have white shoulder epaulettes;

Name: Eptesicus capensis
Description: insectivore; body-length: 8-9cm; dark greyish brown fur with white to yellowish underparts; the forehead is dome-shaped; small ears;

Name: Equus quagga
Description: herbivore; height: 110-145cm; this Zebra is thick built and short legged; the body is white with thick,vertical, black stripes alternating with lighter shadow stripes; the stripes become less distinct towards the hooves; the ears are small;

Name: Equus zebra hartmannae
Description: herbivore; the coat is yellowish-white with narrow black stripes; the stripes go all the way to the hooves; the belly remains white; there is a dewlap; the stripes on the buttocks are narrower than those of the Cape Mountain Zebra;

Name: Equus zebra zebra
Description: herbivore; height: 120 -15cm; The coat is white with close black stripes; the stripes on the buttocks are broad; the stripes go all the way to the hooves; the belly remains white; on the nose there is an orange suffusion;there is a dewlap; males are larger than females;

Name: Eragrostis lehmanniana
Description: perennial grass, abundant, conspicious bend at the lowermost nodes of the culms, reproduces vegetatively through touching the groung with its nodes, slender but sturdy tufted grass, stick-like

Name: Eragrostis trichophora
Description: perennial grass, 60cm tall, slender and wiry appearance, branched culms with purple nodes, inflorescence is an open panicle with branches arranged in whorls

Name: Eriocephalus microphyllus var. pubescens
Description: shrub, up to 1m tall, very small reddish flowers, white seeds puffs which cover the ground like snow, small leaves with strong aromatic fragrance

Name: Eriospermum bakerianum
Description: herb; basal, heart-shaped leaves; small, white flowers in a multi-branched inflorescence

Name: Eupodotis ruficrista
Description: omnivore; body-length: 50 cm; brownish above; black below; red crest is only visible in displaying males

Name: Falco biarmicus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 40-45 cm, rufous and black head and crown; pinkish underside; dark back

Name: Falco chicquera
Description: carnivore; body-length: 30-36 cm, chestnut head and nape; dark brown moustach-like patches on the face; black and white barred belly; white throat; grey tail with black band

Name: Falco naumanni
Description: carnivore; body-length: 30 cm, chestnut, unspotted back; grey head, tail and secondaries

Name: Falco peregrinus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 34-38 cm, black forehead and crown; black moustach-like marks in the face; white underside speckled with black

Name: Falco rupicoloides
Description: carnivore; body-length: 36-40 cm, plumage chestnut with black spots and barrs; whitish underwing

Name: Felis nigripes
Description: carnivore: height: 25cm; this is the smallest cat in Africa; its coat varies from cinnamon to tawny and is patterned with dark spots that merge to form rings and stripes on the tail, legs and neck;

Name: Felis sylvestris lybica
Description: carnivore; the African Wild Cat resembles the domestic cat; its colour varies from grey to dark grey with redddish stripes on the legs and a reddish tinge on the back of the ears; they are larger than the African black-footed Cat and have less spots;

Name: Francolinus adspersus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 35-38 cm; dark brown plumage without streaks or blotches; red bill; yellow skin around the eyes

Name: Francolinus levaillantoides
Description: omnivore; body-length: 35 cm; speckled, dark brown plumage; white throat; dark necklace

Name: Galago moholi
Description: omnivore; body-length: 14-17cm; this small primate has light brown fur with e yellow tinge towards the belly and limbs; the extremely large, bare ears can be moved independently and have four vertical ridges; the large eyes are surrounded by a dark mask; the hind legs are longer than the forelegs;

Name: Galerella flavescens
Description: omnivore; the coat is dark reddish-brown with the last third of the tail black; the Slender Mongoose and the Kaokoland Slender Mongoose can be distinguished by habitat and the darker colour of the Kaokoland Slander Mongoose;

Name: Galerella pulverulenta
Description: omnivore; this Mongoose looks grey from a distance but is actually black with white and grey speckles; it can be distinguished from the other Mongooses by colour and habitat;

Name: Galerella sanguinea
Description: omnivore; the colour of this Mongoose is usually correlated with the soil colour for camouflage and ranges from yellowish-grey to reddish; the long and upwards bent tail has a black tip;

Name: Geigeria pectidea
Description: small bush, 10 – 30cm tall, flowers grouped in small compact heads, outer flowers unisexual (female) and inner flowers bisexual, grows in riverbeds, causes paralysis of the oesophagus, pneumonia and vomiting when eaten by sheep

Name: Genetta genetta
Description: carnivore; this cat-like animal has a grey coat with black spots on it; the tail is very long and has grey and black rings, the tip is always white; the ears are very thin and rounded; each individual has a characteristic face mask;

Name: Genetta maculata
Description: carnivore; small cat-like animal with a grey coat and rustbrown spots and stripes; a distinct band of rustbrown hair begins at the shoulders and ends at the base of the tail; the tail is grey with rustbrown rings, the tip is black; the face is light with white marks underneath the eyes and on the muzzle which are divided by a black mark;

Name: Genetta tigrina
Description: carnivore; this cat-like animal has a greyish-white coat with dark spots; the tail is long and and dark with white rings, the tip is black; a distinct band of dark hair begins just behind the shoulders and ends at the base of the tail; there are white spots underneath the eyes and the cheeks are white, these white areas are divided by a dark mark;

Name: Giraffa camelopardalis
Description: herbivore; characteristic are the long legs and the very long neck; the whitish-yellow body is covered with brown patches that get darker as the animal ages; on top of the head are two short horns that are covered with black hair; they have a mane of short, stiff hair;

Name: Gnidia polycephala
Description: bush, up to 1,5 m tall, yellow flowers, almost leafless greenish branches, fluffy seeds dispersed by wind, contains poisonous substances when flowering

Name: Gomphocarpus fruticosus
Description: herb or shrublet; up to 1,5 m tall; produces milky, poisonous latex; lance-shaped leaves; up to 10 yellow flowers in an axillary umbel; fruit is a heart-shaped, hairy follicle;the seeds have a parachute of long hairs

Name: Graphiurus murinus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 7-16cm; the fur is grey on the back and white on the underparts; the tail is long(5-13 cm) and fluffy; the eyes have a black mark around them; the ears are round;

Name: Grewia flava
Description: slightly hairy shrub, up to 3m tall, pale green leaves, yellow flowers, red-brown round fruits 8 mm in diameter

Name: Grewia flavescens
Description: shrub; 2-3 m tall; 4-angled stems; large hairy leaves; yellow flowers grow in axillary clusters; small, two- or four-lobed fruit

Name: Grewia retinervis
Description: bush, 2m tall, elliptic leaves with serrate margins, bright yellow flowers, reddish-brown, spherical fruit (diameter: 8mm)

Name: Gypohierax angolensis
Description: carnivore; body-length: 60 cm, black plumage; white tipped wings; black tail

Name: Gyps africanus
Description: nivore; body-length: 110 cm, wedge-shaped tail and long, narrow wings;rust-coloured below and dark above; pale head with black face and 'beard'

Name: Haliaeetus vocifer
Description: carnivore; body-length: 63-73 cm; white head, breast and tail; brown belly and forewings; black wings

Name: Harpagophytum procumbens
Description: perennial herb, purple flowers with yellow inside throat, fruit capsules with long bent hooks, woody creepers up to 1,5 m long, root tubers used as medicine

Name: Helichrysum argyrosphaerum
Description: short runners rich in flowers, flowers mostly yellow with a pink edge or white becoming gradually pink towards the centre, hairy spoon-shaped leaves

Name: Heliotropium ciliatum
Description: erect, perennial herb; up to 80 cm tall; stems hairy; lance- to egg-shaped, alternate leaves; white flowers in a unilateral spike; fruit is a drupe

Name: Helogale parvula
Description: carnivore; body-length: 20-30 cm; the coat is dark brown to rust-brown; the ears are prominent;

Name: Hermannia tomentosa
Description: perennial herb or shrublet; spreading growth; up to 40 cm tall; narrrow, hairy leaves with serrate margins; yellow or pink flowers; fruit is a hairy capsule

Name: Hermbstaedtia fleckii
Description: annual, erect herb; up to 60 cm tall; linear, hairy leaves; the inflorescence is a terminal spike with a hairy axis and white to magenta flowers

Name: Hermbstaedtia linearis
Description: annual herb, up to 40 cm tall, perennial rootstock, small purple flowers in a terminal spike-shaped inflorescence

Name: Herpestes ichneumon
Description: carnivore; body-length: 50-60 cm; they have a long, low-slung form; the grey coat is dotted with brownish speckles; the tail ends with a black tassel;

Name: Hippopotamus amphibius
Description: herbivore; height: 150-165 cm; this very large semiaquatic animal is generally grey-brown but the belly and skinfolds are yellowish-pink; it has a very large mouth; the nostrils and the eyes are on top of the head; the ears are small and rounded;

Name: Hipposideros caffer
Description: insectivore; body-length: 8-9 cm, wing-span: 29 cm; the colour varies from grey-brown to golden-yellow; the ears are large and pointy; the nose-leaf is horseshoe-shaped; some have large (4 cm) teats in the pubic area;

Name: Hippotragus equinus
Description: herbivore; height: 135 cm, the coat is reddish-brown and has an erect mane, the belly is lighter brown and the tail is dark brown to black, the face is black with white patches in front of the eyes and a white mouth, both sexes have horns which curve backwards, females are slightly smaller

Name: Hippotragus niger
Description: herbivore; height: 135 cm; the coat is dark brown on the back and white on the belly and buttocks; the face is white with three vertical black stripes; both sexes have horns which curve backwards; the female is slightly smaller than the male

Name: Hoffmannseggia burchellii
Description: erect, hairy herb; up to 30 cm tall; pinnately compound leaves; orange or red to purple flowers arranged in racemes; fruit is an oblong pod

Name: Hoodia gordonii
Description: succulent, 0,5 – 1 m tall, large dusty pink flowers, greyish green or greyish brown colour of the plant, plant is said to suppress the appetite (not scientifically proven)

Name: Hyaena brunnea
Description: carnivore; height: 70-80 cm; the animal is dark brown with a light  cloak on the shoulders and neck, the back and neck are covered in long fur; the belly and forehead are lighter coloured; the legs are dark and have light rings; it has large, pointy ears; the forequarters are more strongly developed than the hindquarters, the back is sloping;

Name: Hydrictis maculicollis
Description: carnivore; body-length: 70-75 cm; the fur is usually reddish to brown with white spots on the chest and throat; it has sleek and webbed paws for swimming;

Name: Hypoxis nitida
GBIF_NAME: Hypoxis obtusa Burch. ex Ker Gawl.

Name: Hystrix africaeaustralis
Description: herbivore; body-length: 60-80 cm; this very large rodent is covered with quills and spines; the 30-50 cm long quills are white with black rings; the belly,legs and face are covered with short, coarse hair; females are larger than males;

Name: Ichneumia albicauda
Description: omnivore; body-length  60cm; the coat is grey-brown; the hind legs are very long causing the back to slant forward when it walks; the tail is covered in long white hair;

Name: Ictonyx striatus
Description: carnivore; height 10-15cm; this short legged predator has black fur with 4 parallel, white stripes on the back; it has white marks underneath the ears and between the eyes;

Name: Indigofera alternans
Description: plant with small racemes of purple-red flowers, hairy green leaves, creeper, annual, small pea-like seeds

Name: Indigofera charlieriana
Description: erect or creeping herb, up to 30 cm tall; compound leaves with lance-shaped leaflets; fruit is a backwards curved pod witch grows in clusters; pink or purple flowers

Name: Ipomoea bolusiana
Description: creeping or erect, perennial herb; hairless leaves;  the pinkish flowers with 5 fused petals are trumpet-shaped; fruit is a capsule

Name: Kobus leche
Description: herbivore; height: 95cm; the shoulders are lower than the crop, causing the body to slope forward;  the coat is reddish-brown on the back, lighter lower on the body and white on the belly; the legs are brown, the front legs have characteristic vertical black stripes; males are bigger than females and have horns;

Name: Kobus vardonii
Description: herbivore; height: 80cm; the coat is golden brown, becoming lighter on the belly and darker on the face; white areas around the eyes and the mouth; the Puku can be distinguished from the Lechwe by the smaller size, the straight back and the absence of the black stripes on the front legs,

Name: Kyllinga alba
Description: hairless sedge; up to 50 cm tall; leaves are bright green; the round, white inflorescences are attached to the erect flowering stems as terminal clusters; the spikelets are white or cinnamon coloured; the roots are aromatic

Name: Lebeckia linearifolia
Description: 2m tall shrub, yellow flowers, blue-grey foliage, linear leaves divided in three, pods

Name: Lemniscomys rosalia
Description: herbivore; length: 27cm; colour ranges from pale grey to brown, down the mid-back is a characteristic dark stripe; the long tail is slim with little hair;

Name: Leptailurus serval
Description: carnivore; height 55-65cm; the Serval is a slender cat with long legs, a small head and large rounded ears; the colour ranges from dull white to golden-yellow with black stripes down the neck and black spots on the body; it can be distinguished from the Cheetah by the lack of tear marks and the larger ears;

Name: Leptoptilos crumeniferus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 150 cm; white body, black wings; naked head and neck; large, pointy bill; whitish legs

Name: Lepus capensis
Description: herbivore; this typical hare has well developed hind legs for running and leaping; the ears as well as the eyes are large; the colour of the coat varies from light brown to reddish to sandy grey; the females are larger than the males;

Name: Lepus saxatilis
Description: herbivore; body-length: 45-65cm; the fur on the back is grizzled gray with black speckles; the belly is white; the short tail is dark on top and white underneath; the erect ears are prominent; the Scrub Hare is larger than the Cape Hare

Name: Lonchocarpus nelsii
GBIF_NAME: Lonchocarpus nelsii Schinz ex Heering & Grimme

Name: Loxodonta africana
Description: herbivore; height: 3-3,75m; the African Bush elephant has large flat ears; its trunk ends with two opposing extensions; both sexes have large tusks; females are smaller and have smaller tusks;

Name: Lycaon pictus
Description: carnivore; height: 75cm; these canids have a short dark snout and large, round ears; the body and legs are white with yellow, brown and black blotches, the bushy tail is white; the pattern and colour differs among individuals; down the centre of the forehead is a dark stripe;

Name: Lycium bosciifolium
Description: shrub, up to 3m tall, thorny stems, small green lance-shaped hairless leaves, long dirty white to greenish flowers with dark violet lobes, the fruit is a glossy, purplish berry

Name: Macroscelides proboscideus
Description: carnivore; length: 23cm, tail-length: 12cm; grey-brownish coloured fur; elongated highly mobile snout; thin round ears; long sparsely haired tail;

Name: Madoqua kirkii
Description: herbivore; height: 50-17cm; the coat is grey-brown with fine speckles on the back and buttocks, while the neck and flanks are lighter brown; the belly and the area around the eyes are nearly white; on the forehead is a long tuft of hair, which can be raised; the upper lip is longer than the lower lip; males have short horns that slope backwards;

Name: Manis temminckii
Description: insectivore; body-length: 40-70cm; this animal is covered in very hard, brown scales, giving it a pine-cone like look; only the belly,face and insides of the strong legs are naked; it has a small head with a pointed snout; the tongue is very long (25 cm) and sticky making it perfect for ant and termite hunt;

Name: Melierax canorus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 54-63 cm; pale grey plumage; white rump; orange bill and legs

Name: Mellivora capensis
Description: omnivore; height: 25-30cm; the body is black with a  broad, greyish-white saddle on the back and head;the legs are short and equipped with sharp claws; the black tail is short; the ears are very small;

Name: Micronisus gabar
Description: carnivore; body-length: 30-34 cm; grey throat and breast; reddish legs and cere; grey wings

Name: Milvus migrans
Description: carnivore; body-length: 56 cm; long forked tail; dark plumage

Name: Miniopterus schreibersi
Description: insectivore; body-length: 5-6 cm, wing-span: 30-35 cm; the dorsal pelage is grey-brown the  underside is lighter; the wingmembrane is almost black; the tail is almost a long as the body (5 cm); the snout is short and the ears relatively small;

Name: Momordica balsamina
Description: perennial climber; leaves are divided into 5-7 lobes, the margins toothed; the flowers are white to yellow with fused petals; the egg-shaped fruit is orange to red when ripe and covered with spines; the plant emits an unpleasent smell when bruised

Name: Monechma genistifolium
Description: perennial shrub, 60cm tall,whitish branches, opposite, elliptical leaves, the single snapdragon-like flowers are whitish with purple veining, fruit is a capsule with round, black seeds

Name: Monechma incanum
Description: 0,5 m tall, blue-grey coloured hairy, leafy bush, woody, sparse white flowers, grows in dune valleys or near sand pans and saline depressions

Name: Mungos mungo
Description: carnivore; body-length: 30-45 cm; the colour varies from light grey to reddish-brown with dark crossbands on the back; the ears are small and round; the snout is pointed;

Name: Necrosyrtes monachus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 70 cm; brown plumage; bare head with red skin

Name: Neophron percnopterus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 62 cm; white plumage; wings with black primaries; white tail

Name: Neotragus moschatus
Description: herbivore; height: 30-40 cm; light brown to reddish-brown coat with white speckles on the back; the belly and insides of the legs are white; the tail is long and dark with white margins, it is white underneath; the upper lip is longer than the lower lip; the males are smaller and have straight horns that slope backwards in line with the face;

Name: Nerine laticoma
Description: up to 50 cm tall, perennial, umbels of white flowers with a red stripe on each petal, leaves only appear when flowering, flowers poisonous for livestock, bulb used as medicine

Name: Nidorella resedifolia
Description: erect herb; up to 1 m tall; deeply divided, hairy leaves; groups of small yellow flowerheads composed only of disc florets

Name: Numida meleagris
Description: omnivore; body-length: 56 cm; grey plumage with white dots; blue and red skin on the head

Name: Nycteris thebaica
Description: carnivore; body-length: 8-16 cm, wing-span: 27-30 cm; long and silky fur; colour ranges from grey to red and brown; the underparts are greyish white; the ears are enormous; and the large nose leaf is split along the middle of the face;

Name: Ochna pulchra
Description: shrub or tree, up to 6m tall, shiny light green leaves, small sweeetly-scented pale yellow flowers

Name: Olea europaea africana
GBIF_NAME: Olea europaea subsp. cuspidata (Wall. & G.Don) Cif.
Description: up to 6 m tall tree, small cream or white, sweetly scented flowers,

Name: Oreotragus oreotragus
Description: herbivore; height: 60 cm; thick yellow to grey-brown coat with white belly; large tear-shaped markings in front of the eyes; males are smaller than females and have short (8 cm), erect horns; the klipspringer is stouter than the duiker which also lacks the tear marks;

Name: Orycteropus afer
Description: insectivore; height: 60 cm; this animal has a long pig-like snout, large, erect ears and a thick tail; most of the body is naked, only the legs are covered with dark hair; the forefeet have strong claws for digging; it has a long (30 cm), sticky tongue which allows it to catch termites and ants;

Name: Oryx gazella
Description: herbivore; height: 120 cm; the coat is light brown to ash grey with a black stripe along the flanks and on the back; white face with black patches on the snout and high on the forehead; both sexes have long straight horns; females are slightly smaller than males,

Name: Osyris lanceolata
Description: evergreen shrub; up to 4 m tall; alternat, lance-shaped leaves; small cream-coloured flowers grow in clusters in the leaf-axils; small, red fleshy fruit

Name: Otocyon megalotis
Description: insectivore; height 30-40 cm; the Bat-eard Fox gets its name from the big (14 cm), rounded ears; the coat is brownish-grey with a lighter belly, it is very fluffy; the bushy,black tail has a black tip;

Name: Otolemur crassicaudatus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 25-50 cm, tail-length: 30-50 cm; the silvery-brown to grey fur is thick and woolly, the underside is lighter coloured; the large eyes ears are characteristic; the hind legs are very powerful and larger than the forelegs; it is bigger than the Moholi Bushbaby and its tail is much thicker and woollier;

Name: Otomys angoniensis
Description: herbivore; length: 30 cm; pale to dark brown with greyish underparts; very short tail dark above and paler below; very large ears; larger than the similar Vlei rat

Name: Ourebia ourebi
Description: herbivore; height: 55 cm; light rusty-brown coat with white belly and throat; the tail is black on top and white underneath; white patches are found around the eyes and the mouth; the males are slightly smaller then the females and have short (10 cm) horns hat curve slightly forward at the tips

Name: Oxalis lawsonii
Description: annual or perennial herb; purple-pink flowers; juicy, thick tap root; tubers along the lateral root; likes water

Name: Oxygonum alatum
Description: small pink flowers; runners; appears after rain

Name: Pancratium tenuifolium
Description: geophyte; up to 40cm tall; leaves are linear ande twisted; large white flowers

Name: Panicum coloratum
Description: grass with orange or purple coloured spikelets

Name: Panthera leo
Description: carnivore; height: 110-120 cm; the Lion is the largest cat in Africa and the only one where the males have manes, the colour of the mane ranges from blonde to black; the back of the round ears is black; the males are much larger than the females and have manes;

Name: Panthera pardus pardus
Description: carnivore; height: 45-80 cm; the Leopard has shorter legs than most felines; the colour of its coat varies from white to golden-brown, with black spots, often 6 to 8 spots form a rosette; the ears are rounded; it differs from the Cheetah in having shorter legs and rosette-like spots, also it lacks the tear marks from eye to mouth;

Name: Papio ursinus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 50-115 cm, tail-length: 50-70 cm; the fur is generally dark brown to grey on the back and lighter on  the underparts and on the sides of the face; the face is long and downwards-sloping; the first part of the long tail is carried upwards while the rest hangs down;

Name: Paraxerus cepapi
Description: omnivore; body-length: 35 cm, half of which is tail; the colour varies depending on the region from pale grey to brown; the head and legs are rusty coloured; the chest is lighter coloured; the long, bushy tail is carried extended backwards;

Name: Parkinsonia africana
Description: 3 m tall, yellow flowers, green bark, thin leaves, short thickish thorns, 90 mm long thin red-brown pods

Name: Parotomys brantsii
Description: Herbivore; length: 25 cm; pale yellow-brown fur with lighter underparts;

Name: Pechuel-loeschea leubnitziae
Description: up to 2 m tall, grey-green shrub, bitter aroma of stems and leaves, small purple flowers

Name: Pedetes capensis
Description: omnivore; body-length: 35-45 cm; the Springhare is actually a rodent; with its powerful hind legs and the short forelegs it resembles a small kangaroo (though unrelated), it can leap over 2m in one jump; the colour of the coat varies from pale grey to reddish brown, the underparts are white; the long tail always has a broad black tip; it has long ears and conspicuously large eyes;

Name: Pelea capreolus
Description: herbivore; height: 100 cm; brown, woolly coat; the belly and the underparts of the tail are white; long and pointy ears; the males are bigger than the females and have straight horns; the grey rhebok can be distinguished from the mountain reebok by the straight horns and the lack of the black spots below the ears;

Name: Pentzia incana
Description: 0,3 m tall, grey-green shrub, yellow flowers, seeds dispersed by wind, vegetative reproduction through anchors, leaves are sticky and have fragrant oils

Name: Pergularia daemia
Description: perennial climber; hairy, hand-shaped leaves; small, cream-coloured flowers with fused petals; the fruit is  bright red and contains many seeds

Name: Petromus typicus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 27-38 cm including the tail; the Dassie rat is neither a Dassie nor a rat, it is a rodent of squirrel-like appearance but with a less bushy tail; the fur is dark brown to grey with lighter underparts;

Name: Phacochoerus africanus
Description: omnivore; the body is grey and sparsely covered with long bristles; there is a mane of dark hair with lighter tips; the adults have large tusks which curve over the broad snout; the males have larger tusks than the females and have three pairs of warts on the sides of the face; they run with their tail up;

Name: Philantomba monticola
Description: herbivore: height: 35 cm; the coat is dark grey-brown on the back while the belly, chest and throat are light brown; underneath each eye is a horizontal black stripe; both sexes have short horns that lie back in line with the face; males are slightly smaller than females:

Name: Phyllanthus maderaspatensis
Description: perennial herb; up to 30 cm tall; lanceolate leaves; small, singular, yellow to green flowers; fruit is a small capsule on a slender stalk

Name: Pipistrellus nanus
Description: insectivore; total body-length: 7-8 cm, half of which is tail; the fur is dark brown with reddish to golden tips, the underparts are lighter; the mouth is large and the ears are triangular;

Name: Platycarpha carlinoides
Description: plant with cone-shaped tap root, ring of basal incised leaves, two or three floral whorls with bright purple flowers in the middle, grows in riverbeds of the Kalahari

Name: Plectropterus gambensis
Description: herbivore; body-length: 100 cm, black plumage on the back; white on the belly; red bill; white face;

Name: Podaxis sp.
Description: dispersed, solitary, cream-coloured fungus; 20 cm tall; cone-shaped fruit-bodies; inedible

Name: Polemaetus bellicosus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 78-83 cm; dark head and throat; white, spotted breast; dark wings

Name: Pollichia campestris
Description: herb or shrublet; up to 40 cm tall; small, strap-shaped leaves arranged in whorls; very small yellow leaves in axillary clusters; fruit is a white berry;

Name: Potamochoerus larvatus
Description: omnivore; height: 60-100 cm; very hairy, grey-brown body; the mane and the upper parts of the face are lighter in colour; the snout is blunt and muscular; the tusks are small but very sharp;

Name: Procavia capensis
Description: herbivore; body-length: 50 cm; this stockily built animal has a dark brown to light grey fur (depending on the area); on the back is a patch of darker hair; it has prominent upper incisors;

Name: Pronolagus crassicaudatus
Description: herbivore; this is the largest Red rock rabbit; its thick woolly coat is reddish coloured; the bushy tail is red- brown to dark brown on both sides;

Name: Pronolagus randensis
Description: herbivore; this rabbit has a salt-and-pepper fur of reddish-brown colour; the underparts are lighter; the chin and cheeks are whitish-grey; it has strong hind legs and large, sparsely haired ears;

Name: Pronolagus rupestris
Description: herbivore; height: 40-60 cm; the thick hair on the back is of a warm brown; the underparts are lighter; the tail is dark brown; the long ears and the face are grey;

Name: Proteles cristata
Description: insectivore; height: 40-50 cm; the coat is brownish-yellow with approximately five distinct vertical stripes on the back; the snout and lower parts of the legs are black; the bushy tail has a black tip; it has large, rotatable ears; it can be distinguished from the Hyaenas by its smaller size;

Name: Pseudogaltonia clavata
Description: perennial, bulbous plant; cream-brown bulb with a diameter up to 15 cm; large grey-green leaves; one single, multi-flowered inflorescence grows on a long stalk; the tubulus flowers are white with light-green stripes; fruit is a 3-chambered capsule

Name: Pupalia lappacea
Description: erect or sprawling herb; up to 90 cm tall; stems with multiple opposite branches that grow from nodes; branches are 4-angled; the mature inflorescence is up to 50 cm long and has green flowers; fruit is a capsule with shiny brown seeds

Name: Radyera urens
Description: pumpkin-like herb, lobed, hairy, grey-green leaves with finely pleated edges, runners up to 1,2 m long, hairs cause slight burning sensation on contact, bad smell when dry, small red pumpkin-like flowers, cucumber-like fruit

Name: Raphicerus campestris
Description: herbivore; height: 55cm; light brown to brick brown coat, the belly and the insides of the legs are white; the males are smaller than the females and have short (9 cm), straight and very sharp horns; the steenbok differs from the Oribi by the brown tail,

Name: Raphicerus melanotis
Description: herbivore; height: 50cm; the coat is dark, reddish brown with white speckles; the belly and insides of the legs are light brown; the ears are long and pointed; the males have short (8 cm) straight horns; it can be distinguished from the steenbok by the white speckles and the habitat;

Name: Raphicerus sharpei
Description: herbivore; height: 45-60cm; the coat is light brown; the belly and insides of the legs are white; the ears are large and have rounded tips; the male has very short (6 cm) erect horns and is slightly smaller than the female; it is lighter in colour than the grey grysbok

Name: Redunca arundinum
Description: herbivore; height: 85cm, the coat is yellowish brown on the back and white on the belly, the forelegs are dark brown in front, the tail is bushy and white underneath, males are larger and have horns, the southern reedbuck can be distinguished from the Impala by the lack of the three black stripes on the hindquarters and the less red colour, and from the mountain reedbuck by its bigger size and the habitat

Name: Redunca fulvorufula
Description: herbivore; height: 75cm, the coat is made of long, grey hair, the belly is white, the tail is bushy and white underneath, below the ears are characteristic black spots, the ears are rounded with a white fringe, the males are larger than the females and have short (14 cm) horns, the mountain reedbuck differs from the grey rhebok by its shorter, thicker neck and the rounded ears

Name: Rhabdomys pumilio
Description: herbivore; length: 19cm; the fur is brown on the back and white on the belly; an the back are four characteristic dark stripes;

Name: Rhigozum brevispinosum
Description: shrub, 1-2,5m tall, the branches are covered with spines, simple, oblanceolate leaves are borne in tufts of 9-13, the large flowers are golden-yellow and sweelty scented, the fruit is a 7cm long pale brown capsule

Name: Rhigozum trichotomum
Description: Shrub, 1-2m tall, egg-shaped leaves, solitary, white to salmon coloured flowers with a diameter up to 4cm, the fruit is a grey spindle-shaped capsule up to 10cm long

Name: Rhinolophus clivosus
Description: insectivore; body-length: 7-8cm, wing-span: 35cm; the coat is light brown on the back and yellowish-grey on the underside; the nose leaf is complex and horseshoe-shaped the ears are long and sharply pointed;

Name: Rhus tenuinervis
Description: thorny shrub, 1-2m tall, trifoliate leathery leaves, leaves are velvety below with toothed margins, small greenish-white to cream flowers; the fruit is a brownish-red, diamond shaped, flat drupe;

Name: Rousettus aegyptiacus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 15cm, wing-span: 60cm; dark brown fur; pointy ears;

Name: Saccostomus campestris
Description: herbivore; body-length: 9-18cm; the fur is grey-brown on the back, lighter on the flanks and white on the belly; the tail is short; the eyes are small; it can store food in cheek-pouches;

Name: Sagittarius serpentarius
Description: carnivore; body-length: 140 cm; white plumage; long black feathered legs; black tail; large reddish eyepatch

Name: Sarkidiornis melanotos
Description: omnivore; body-length: 65 - 80 cm, black and white plumage; speckled grey head; male larger than female; in breeding season the male has a large comb on the bill

Name: Schmidtia kalihariensis
Description: Kalahari's most prominent annual grass, up to 1 m tall, produces an acidic secretion with strong smell, hardy grass with the tendency to become almost biennal in years of good rainfall, culms grow erect from a bent base, culms, dull striped sheaths and leaf blades densely haired, glands at the tips of the hairs that secrete a sticky organic acid (in maturity) that has devastating effects on humans and animals

Name: Schmidtia pappophoroides
Description: perennial grass; 90 cm high; inflorescence is a panicle; the spikelets have five awns; leaves are blue-green and sometimes curled at the tip

Name: Schoenoplectus muricinux
Description: perennial sedge; up to 1,5 m tall; woody rhizome; reduced leaves; inflorescence is a cluster of congested, straw-coloured spikelets with brownish markings; the fruit is shining black when mature

Name: Scopus umbretta
Description: carnivore; body-length: 56 cm; dark brown plumage; long legs; hammer-shaped profile of the head; long dark bill

Name: Senna italica
Description: perennial herb; op to 40 cm tall; hairy stems rise from a black, woody rootstock; pinnately compound leaves; leaflets with rounded tips; yellow flowers; fruit is a large and flat pod

Name: Sericorema remotiflora
Description: bushy herb; up to 1 m tall; slender branches; linear leaves; white to yellow flowers; fruit is a fluffy ball with smooth, shiny seeds

Name: Sesamum triphyllum
Description: erect, annual herb; 25-200 cm; solitary, dark pink flowers with darker centre; small, butterfly-shaped seeds; fruit oblong capsule; aromatic leaves

Name: Sida chysantha
Description: herb; about 30-50 cm tall; branched at the base; oblong leaves; golden yellow flowers; fruit is a capsule

Name: Sigmoceros lichtensteinii
Description: herbivore; height: 125 cm; the coat is chestnut or yellow-brown; the buttocks are a lighter colour; the tail and the shins are black; the shoulders are humped; both sexes heve horns that rise on a single pedicel; it can be distinguished from the Red Hartebeest by the lack of black blazes;

Name: Solanum capense
Description: shrub, 0,45 m tall, cream to pale purple coloured flowers, yellow berries, slightly hairy leaves, slightly thorny stem, moderate toxicity of the apples

Name: Solanum supinum
Description: sprawling shrub, 40 cm tall, leaf margings deeply undulated, leaves covered with hairs, solitary white or pale violet flowers, fruit is a yellow berry

Name: Stephanoaetus coronatus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 80-90 cm; dark plumage; grey above; rufous below; long tail

Name: Stipagrostis amabilis
Description: perennial large shrub-like grass, up to 2 m tall, colonizer of unstable dune tops, expanded rootstock system, tufted growth

Name: Stipagrostis ciliata
Description: perennial tufted grass, up to 1 m tall, nodes on the culms with characteristic white rings of white hair, large open panicles with long brownish awns

Name: Stipagrostis obtusa
Description: small perennial tufted grass, dense basal leaf covering, up to 60 cm tall, pioneer and climax grass, curled blue-green leaves, one of the most important grazing resources

Name: Stipagrostis uniplumis
Description: perennial grass, soft feather-shaped hairy awns, tufts of hair at the base of the awns and at the nodes, lifespan of about five years, luxuriant seed production, high grazing value

Name: Struthio camelus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 2 m;  male: black and white plumage; female brown and white plumage;

Name: Suricata suricatta
Description: carnivore; body-length: 25-35cm; the colour is silvery-brown with darker spots which may merge into crosslines on the lower back; the tail is not bushy and dark tipped;

Name: Sylvicapra grimmia
Description: herbivore; height: 50cm; the coat varies in colour from light grey-brown to red-brown; the belly and the insides of the legs are white; the front legs have vertical black stripes; there is a tuft of long, black hair on the forehead;the short tail is dark on top and white underneath; females are larger and lack horns;

Name: Syncerus caffer
Description: herbivore; height: 1-1,7m; this cattle-like animal is born with a light reddish-brown coat that darkens with age until it is grey-black; both sexes are horned, but the horns of the male are especially large with thick bosses;

Name: Tadarida aegyptiaca
Description: insectivore; body-length: 10-12cm, wing-span: 35cm; greyish-brown dorsal coat; very large ears; long snout with slightly upturned lip;

Name: Talinum crispatulum
Description: herb; 5-15 cm tall; erect and spreading, pinkish stems; large roots; succlent, linear leaves; bright yellow flowers; seeds are small and shining black

Name: Taphozous mauritianus
Description: insectivore; body-length: 10-11cm, wing-span: 18-20cm; the dorsal pelage is grizzles grey, the ventral fur is characteristically white; the ears are large and triangular;

Name: Tarchonanthus camphoratus
Description: shrub or tree, 1-8m tall depending on climate, greyish-green, oblongate leaves with whitish felt, creamy-white flowerheads in terminal panicles, the small fruit is covered with white hairs

Name: Tatera leucogaster
Description: omnivore; length: 28cm (including the tail); the fur is orange-brown to reddish-brown; the eyes are large;

Name: Terathopius ecaudatus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 55-70 cm; black, white and chestnus plumage; short tail; long wings; res face

Name: Terfezia pfeilii
Description: desert truffle; fruit body 3-4cm in diameter; occurs 5-40cm under the surface of the sand; symbiotic relationships with certain plants

Name: Terminalia sericea
Description: 4-8m tall, cream to pale yellow flowers, silvery-grey leaves

Name: Thallomys paedulcus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 12-16cm, tail-length: 13-21cm; grey-yellow on the back and white on the belly; the long tail is brown; dark rings around the eyes;

Name: Thryonomys swinderianus
Description: herbivore; body-length: 60cm; the Greater Canerat's heavyset body is covered in a coarse, yellowish-brown pelage; the underside is much lighter; they have rounded ears; they are bigger than the Lesser Canerat;

Name: Torgos tracheliotus
Description: carnivore; body-length: 100 cm; white thighs; white stripe on the underwing; bare, red skin on face and troat

Name: Tragelaphus angasii
Description: herbivore; height: 110 cm, white vertical stripes on the back, yellow stockinged legs, males are dark blue-grey in colour and have a white chevron mark between the eyes and horns, females are reddish-brown, they lack the chevron mark and horns

Name: Tragelaphus scriptus
Description: herbivore; height: 75-110 cm, white spots on the legs and flanks, females are smaller, lighter in colour and lack horns

Name: Tragelaphus spekeii
Description: herbivore; height: 100 cm, long, grey-brown coat, white spots and stripes on the flanks and the back, white patch on the throat, males have horns and are bigger and darker than females

Name: Tragelaphus strepsiceros
Description: herbivore; height: 140 cm, pale-grey to brownish- grey coat, white, vertical stripes on the flanks, white chevron mark between the eyes, hump on the shoulders, males have twisted horns,

Name: Tribulus terrestris
Description: creeping growth, yellow flowers, flower 1 cm in diameter, soft-haired leaves, woody, sharp, spiny fruits that can puncture animals' hoofs, bare feet and bicycle tyres

Name: Tribulus zeyheri
Description: creeping growth, yellow flowers or white with a yellow centre, flower 4 cm in diameter, soft-haired leaves, woody, sharp, spiny fruits that can puncture animals' hoofs, bare feet and bicycle tyres

Name: Trichophyton schoenleinii
GBIF_NAME: Trichophyton schoenleinii (Lebert) Langeron & Miloch. ex Nann.

Name: Trigonoceps occipitalis
Description: carnivore; body-length: 80 cm; dark plumage with large white to grey areas on the wings; head and neck are white; orange bill

Name: Turnix sylvaticus
Description: omnivore; body-length: 14 cm; speckled brown plumage

Name: Tylosema esculentum
Description: shrub or small tree, up to 6m tall, large egg-shaped leaves, covered with short, soft, tawny hairs, greenish-white to yellowish flowers in axillary clusters, fruit is a yellow to brown berry

Name: Vangueria infausta
Description: shrub or small tree, up to 6m tall, large egg-shaped leaves, covered with short, soft, tawny hairs, greenish-white to yellowish flowers in axillary clusters, fruit is a yellow to brown berry

Name: Vulpes chama
Description: carnivore; height 30 cm; the fur is black or silver grey with the flanks and underside yellow; the tip of the bushy tail is always black; it is more slender than the Bat-eared Fox and its ears are smaller;

Name: Xenostegia tridentata
Description: perennial, creeping herb; stems up to 2 m long; lance-shaped leaves can be divided into 3 lobes; single white to yellow flowers; fruit is a straw-coloured capsule with up to 4 brownish seeds

Name: Xerus inauris
Description: omnivore; body-length: 45 cm; the fur is cinnamon on the back and white on the face, belly, and insides of the leg; on the flanks are characteristic white stripes; the bushy tail is as long as the body itself and covered with long whitish hair; the ears are simple openings on the side of the head and the eyes are fairly large;

Name: Ziziphus mucronata
Description: 2 - 5 m tall, yellowish-green flowers, greyish-brown bark, thorns in pairs
